excerpt: Thanks for stopping by for this week’s Style Scouting. My Sunday post where I share the random stuff that captured my attention or inspired me that I found online. photo: At Home With Ashley My husband Ed
text: Thanks for stopping by for this week’s Style Scouting. My Sunday post where I share the random stuff that captured my attention or inspired me that I found online. My husband Ed and I traveled to Virginia to spent the weekend helping our newlywed daughter and her hubby make some improvements on their house. I wrote about the house in this post. (open in same tab) We hung drapes, added storm/screen doors and wallpapered an accent wall in the room that will be my 3rd grandchild’s nursery. Yep – Mandy is pregnant with a boy due in October. :-) We are very excited!!! His room is going to be done in blue, grey and white. I will be sharing more as the room and other projects get completed. Posts You May Have Missed This Week: Where I Find the Best Decorating Inspiration for FREE! (open in same tab) Fashion & Beauty 9 White Skirt/Shorts/Pants Outfits You Can Style With Outfits You Already Have. (open in same tab) I splurged on this hat two summer’s ago after buying ones that just didn’t cover my face enough and stylish at the same time. I wear it whenever I go out of the house and get compliments about it all the time. I even added a cord so when I am out and about and go into a store or office, I can let it drop to my back – hands free. (open in same tab) Fun & Interesting The search is on for Marty McFly’s guitar. Michael J. Fox needs your help to find it. (open in same tab) You can have a real-life night at the museum. (open in same tab) If you use stainless steel pans and don’t want to use oil or butter in the pan, did you know you could use the cut end of a cucumber instead to save on fat and calories. (open in same tab) Something to Think About Great advice and important wisdom from older people. (open in same tab) “All it takes to uncover hidden gems is a clear eye, an open mind, and a willingness to search for inspiration in places other people aren’t willing or able to go.” – Austin Kleon If you enjoy these posts – You can find past Style Scouting posts here. And… If you’re catching up on blog posts you may have missed, be sure to sign-up to get my newest posts via email to stay up to date with everything that’s happening here on the blog and more. html:
Thanks for stopping by for this week’s Style Scouting. My Sunday post where I share the random stuff that captured my attention or inspired me that I found online.

My husband Ed and I traveled to Virginia to spent the weekend helping our newlywed daughter and her hubby make some improvements on their house. I wrote about the house in this post. (open in same tab)

We hung drapes, added storm/screen doors and wallpapered an accent wall in the room that will be my 3rd grandchild’s nursery. Yep – Mandy is pregnant with a boy due in October. :-) We are very excited!!! His room is going to be done in blue, grey and white. I will be sharing more as the room and other projects get completed.

Posts You May Have Missed This Week:

  • Where I Find the Best Decorating Inspiration for FREE! (open in same tab)

Fashion & Beauty

9 White Skirt/Shorts/Pants Outfits You Can Style With Outfits You Already Have. (open in same tab)

I splurged on this hat two summer’s ago after buying ones that just didn’t cover my face enough and stylish at the same time. I wear it whenever I go out of the house and get compliments about it all the time. I even added a cord so when I am out and about and go into a store or office, I can let it drop to my back – hands free. (open in same tab)

Fun & Interesting

The search is on for Marty McFly’s guitar. Michael J. Fox needs your help to find it. (open in same tab)

You can have a real-life night at the museum. (open in same tab)

If you use stainless steel pans and don’t want to use oil or butter in the pan, did you know you could use the cut end of a cucumber instead to save on fat and calories. (open in same tab)

Something to Think About

Great advice and important wisdom from older people. (open in same tab)


“All it takes to uncover hidden gems is a clear eye, an open mind, and a willingness to search for inspiration in places other people aren’t willing or able to go.” – Austin Kleon

If you enjoy these posts – You can find past Style Scouting posts here.

And… If you’re catching up on blog posts you may have missed, be sure to sign-up to get my newest posts via email to stay up to date with everything that’s happening here on the blog and more.
